# Welcome to Speaker Notes Demo

This presentation demonstrates the new speaker notes feature.

<!-- Remember to greet the audience warmly and introduce yourself -->

- Speaker notes are created using HTML comments
- They won't appear on slides
- But presenters can see them in presenter mode

---

## What are Speaker Notes?

Speaker notes help presenters remember key points without cluttering slides.

<!--
Key talking points:
- Explain that speaker notes are invisible to the audience
- Mention they're useful for timing and transitions
- Give examples of when to use them
-->

- Keep slides clean and minimal
- Add detailed notes for the presenter
- Improve presentation delivery

---

## How to Add Speaker Notes

Simply use HTML comment syntax in your markdown:

```markdown
<!-- This is a speaker note -->
```

<!-- Demo this live if possible. Show the markdown source and the resulting PowerPoint. -->

---

## Multiple Notes Per Slide

You can add multiple comments throughout a slide.

<!-- First note: introduce the concept -->

- Each comment becomes part of the speaker notes
- Multiple comments are combined
- Order is preserved

<!-- Second note: emphasize the flexibility of this approach -->

---

## Advanced Features

<!--
Advanced talking points:

- Special characters are preserved: <>&"'

- Multi-line comments supported
- Special characters handled correctly
- Unicode support included
- Markdown in comments preserved

## Best Practices

<!--
Timing: 2 minutes for this slide

Best practices to mention:

- Use notes for timing and pacing
- Include transition cues
- Add reminders for demos
- Keep audience engagement high
